cyclone.name: ETA
cyclone.category: Tropical Storm (forecast to become Cat-1 hurricane near the Keys)
cyclone.current_location: about 115 mi ESE of Marathon, Florida / 140 mi SSE of Miami, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest through the Florida Straits, expected to cross or graze the Florida Keys tonight, then turn westward into the southeastern Gulf of Mexico and eventually drift north toward the northeastern Gulf later in the week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Keys (near Upper Keys / Florida Bay)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Cuban provinces of La Habana westward; Florida coast north of Englewood to Anna Maria Island under Tropical Storm Watch; Bonita Beach to Card Sound Bridge under Storm Surge Watch; Golden Beach to Bonita Beach under Hurricane Watch
weather_observation.warning_coast: Florida Keys Ocean Reef to Dry Tortugas (Hurricane & Storm-Surge Warning); Florida coast Brevard/Volusia line to Englewood and Lake Okeechobee (Tropical Storm Warning); northwestern Bahamas (Tropical Storm Warning)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Cuba, northwestern Bahamas, South & Central Florida peninsula, Florida Keys, eventually northeastern Gulf Coast
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (≤7%) of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; most likely gusts below 35 kt
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal inundation possible, around 1–2 ft above ground level during high tide (Altamaha Sound GA southward)
weather_observation.rainfall: Occasional outer-band showers, generally 1–3 inches total
weather_observation.other_hazards: Elevated surf and rip currents along the Georgia coast later this week
